com.googlecode.sarasvati

Interface NodeToken

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Token
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HibNodeToken, MemNodeToken

    public interface NodeToken
extends Token
    Node tokens point to nodes in the graph. Unlike arc tokens, they may have attributes associated with them.
    Author:
    Paul Lorenz

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<ArcToken> getChildTokens()
      Returns the list of ArcTokens which have this token as their parent.
      Date getCompleteDate()
      Returns the date/time the node token was completed
      Date getCreateDate()
      Returns the date/time the node token was created.
      int getDelayCount()
      The number of times the guard for the related node has evaluated to DelayUntilGuardResult.
      Date getDelayUntilTime()
      If the guard for related node was evaluated and returned DelayUntilGuardResult, this method will return the time at which the guard should be re-evaluated, otherwise it will return null.
      Env getEnv()
      Returns the environment for just this token.
      Env getFullEnv()
      Returns the full environment.
      GuardAction getGuardAction()
      Returns the GuardAction that was returned from the Node guard called on this token or null if the guard has not completed or been called.
      Long getId()
      A unique identifier for this node token.
      Node getNode()
      Returns the node that this token points to.
      List<ArcToken> getParentTokens()
      Returns the list of arc tokens which were involved in creating this NodeToken.
      GraphProcess getProcess()
      Returns the process that this node token belongs to.
      TokenSet getTokenSet(String name)
      Returns the first TokenSet of the given name that this token is tied to, or null if the token is not associated with a token of this name.
      NodeTokenSetMember getTokenSetMember(String name)
      Like getTokenSet(String), except returns the link rather than the the token set itself.
      Set<NodeTokenSetMember> getTokenSetMemberships()
      Returns the set members for each token set that this token is tied to.
      void markComplete()
      Marks this token as being complete, in the sense that it no longer represents an active part of the process.
      void markDelayed(Date delayUntilTime)
      Marks the token as being delayed until a specific time, at which point the guard for the related node will be re-evaluated.
      void setGuardAction(GuardAction action)
      A NodeToken is evaluated by the Node.guard(Engine, NodeToken) method.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.googlecode.sarasvati.Token

        accept, getExecutionType, isComplete, markBacktracked

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        Long getId()
        A unique identifier for this node token. May be globally unique, or may be unique for just the containing GraphProcess.
        Returns:
        A unique identifier for this node token

      • getNode

        Node getNode()
        Returns the node that this token points to.
        Returns:
        The node associated node.

      • getProcess

        GraphProcess getProcess()
        Returns the process that this node token belongs to.
        Returns:
        The associated process

      • getParentTokens

        List<ArcToken> getParentTokens()
        Returns the list of arc tokens which were involved in creating this NodeToken. If this node was the (or one of the) initial tokens created on the start nodes, this list will be empty.
        Returns:
        The list of arc tokens which were involved in creating this NodeToken.

      • getChildTokens

        List<ArcToken> getChildTokens()
        Returns the list of ArcTokens which have this token as their parent. If this NodeToken has not yet been completed, or no arcs match the selected arc name when the node was completed, the list will be empty.
        Returns:
        The list of ArcTokens which have this token as their parent

      • getFullEnv

        Env getFullEnv()
        Returns the full environment. This will include variables set on the token as well as variables set on the process. If a variable with the same name exists in both the token and process environments, the token variable will be returned. NOTE: Changes can only be made at the token level. Updates or removals will only be applied to the token attributes.
        Returns:
        An Env containing variables from this token and from the GraphProcess
        See Also:
        GraphProcess.getEnv()

      • getEnv

        Env getEnv()
        Returns the environment for just this token. Variables defined on the process will not be found.
        Returns:
        An Env containing variables from just this token

      • setGuardAction

        void setGuardAction(GuardAction action)
        A NodeToken is evaluated by the Node.guard(Engine, NodeToken) method. setGuardAction will be called by the engine to record the result of the guard.
        Parameters:
        action - The GuardAction taken with this NodeToken.
        See Also:
        Node.guard(Engine, NodeToken)

      • getGuardAction

        GuardAction getGuardAction()
        Returns the GuardAction that was returned from the Node guard called on this token or null if the guard has not completed or been called.
        Returns:
        The result of the Node guard called on this token, or null if the guard has not completed or been called.

      • getCreateDate

        Date getCreateDate()
        Returns the date/time the node token was created.
        Returns:
        The date/time the node token was created.

      • getCompleteDate

        Date getCompleteDate()
        Returns the date/time the node token was completed
        Returns:
        The date/time the node token was completed.

      • markComplete

        void markComplete()
        Marks this token as being complete, in the sense that it no longer represents an active part of the process. Once a token is marked complete, it is generally only of historical interest.

      • getTokenSet

        TokenSet getTokenSet(String name)
        Returns the first TokenSet of the given name that this token is tied to, or null if the token is not associated with a token of this name. As a general principal, tokens should only belong to one token set with a given name.

        This method must also remove the token from the active sets of any token sets that it belongs to.

        Parameters:
        name - The token set name
        Returns:
        the first TokenSet of the given name that this token is tied to, or null if the token is not associated with a token of this name.

      • getTokenSetMember

        NodeTokenSetMember getTokenSetMember(String name)
        Like getTokenSet(String), except returns the link rather than the the token set itself.
        See Also:
        getTokenSet(String)

      • getTokenSetMemberships

        Set<NodeTokenSetMember> getTokenSetMemberships()
        Returns the set members for each token set that this token is tied to.
        Specified by:
        getTokenSetMemberships in interface Token
        Returns:
        The set of TokenSetMembers tying this token to a token set.

      • getDelayUntilTime

        Date getDelayUntilTime()
        If the guard for related node was evaluated and returned DelayUntilGuardResult, this method will return the time at which the guard should be re-evaluated, otherwise it will return null.
        Returns:
        The time the node guard should be re-evaluated after a DelayUntilGuardResult result, or null if the token has never been delayed.

      • getDelayCount

        int getDelayCount()
        The number of times the guard for the related node has evaluated to DelayUntilGuardResult.
        Returns:
        The number of times the guard for the related node has evaluated to DelayUntilGuardResult.

      • markDelayed

        void markDelayed(Date delayUntilTime)
        Marks the token as being delayed until a specific time, at which point the guard for the related node will be re-evaluated.
        Parameters:
        delayUntilTime - The time until which the node should be delayed.
